name: Horse
distinctions: Is a possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Unicorn
sub_species.hair: White, silver or gold (depending on age)
distinctions: Blood, hair and horn all have potent magical properties

sub_species.name: Winged horse
distinctions: Horses with wings capable of flight
Sometimes used in winged horse races

sub_species.name: Abraxan
sub_species.height: Larger than a normal horse, similar to an elephant
distinctions: Is a rare possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Thestral
sub_species.native: British Isles, France, Iberian Peninsula and Ireland
distinctions: Only visible to those who have witnessed death and accepted its reality
Is a possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Granian
distinctions: Is a rare possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

name: Non-Human Spirituous Apparition
distinctions: Created from and sustained by human emotions

sub_species.name: Dementor
distinctions: Capable of draining humans of happy thoughts, memories and emotions
Hover effortlessly inches above the ground
Negatively alter atmosphere and magically create fog
Force victims to relive their worst memories

sub_species.name: Boggart
distinctions: Transforms into the worst fear of the nearest observer

sub_species.name: Poltergeist
distinctions: Similar to a ghost, but solid and can move objects
Was never a living human being

sub_species.name: Dog
distinctions: Generally friendly and loyal towards humans

sub_species.name: Boarhound
sub_species.hair: Fawn, brindle, black, harlequin, mantle or blue

sub_species.name: Three-headed dog
distinctions: Larger and stronger than non-magical dogs

name: Dragon
distinctions: Is a very rare possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Norwegian Ridgeback
distinctions: Food of choice is large mammals

name: Veela
distinctions: When angry, they transform into harpy-like creatures

sub_species.name: Blast-Ended Skrewt
distinctions: Resemble pale, slimy, deformed shell-less lobsters or scorpions
Males have stingers, females have suckers to suck blood
Shoot fire from their rear end

sub_species.name: Fire Crab
distinctions: Jewelled shell which is extremely valuable

name: Niffler
distinctions: Attracted to shiny objects and metals

sub_species.name: Centaur
distinctions: Lower torso is a horse's body
Higher torso is a human's body
Capable of human intelligence and speech
Skilled in Astronomy, Healing magic and Divination

sub_species.name: Hippogriff
sub_species.hair: Stormy grey, chestnut, bronze, pinkish roan or inky black
sub_species.feathers: Stormy grey, chestnut, bronze, pinkish roan or inky black (matching hair color)
distinctions: Front half of a giant eagle

sub_species.name: Manticore
distinctions: Scorpion's tail with highly poisonous stinger

sub_species.name: Griffin
distinctions: Front half of a giant eagle

sub_species.name: Fairy
distinctions: Very small diminutive humanoid with insect-like wings

name: Goblin
distinctions: Diet of meat, roots and fungi

name: Human
distinctions: Come in various shapes and sizes
Claim to be the most intelligent beings on Earth

sub_species.name: Wizardkind
distinctions: Typically wear long robes and pointed hats
Possess and capable of using magic
Generally abstain from using modern technology

sub_species.name: Non-magic people
distinctions: Lack the ability to perform magic
Most are unaware of the wizarding world
Also known as Muggles in Great Britain

sub_species.name: Squib
distinctions: Children of witches and/or wizards but cannot use magic

name: Bowtruckle
native: Western England, Southern Germany and Scandinavia

sub_species.name: Kneazle
distinctions: Out-sized ears and a tail like that of a lion's
Uncanny ability to detect untrustworthy individuals

sub_species.name: Nundu
distinctions: Resembles leopard and/or lion in appearance

sub_species.name: Wampus cat
distinctions: Eyes capable of hypnosis and legilimency

sub_species.name: Owl
distinctions: Commonly kept for companionship by wizards

sub_species.name: Snowy owl
sub_species.feathers: Mostly white with black or brown markings
distinctions: One of the largest species of owl in North America
Is a possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Screech owl
sub_species.feathers: Brownish hues with whitish, patterned underside)
distinctions: Diet of rabbits, voles, rats, mice and reptiles

sub_species.name: Great grey owl
sub_species.feathers: Mostly silvery grey with patterned white, grey and brown markings
distinctions: One of the larges species of owl in the world
Is a possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Scops owl
distinctions: One of the smallest species of owl in the world
Color and pattern that helps camouflage
Is a possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

sub_species.name: Phoenix
sub_species.feathers: Mostly scarlet with a golden tail

sub_species.name: Budgerigar
sub_species.feathers: Lemon/lime or blue/white, with black markings

name: Erkling
distinctions: High pitch cackles to lure children

sub_species.name: Basilisk
sub_species.feathers: Scarlet plume on top of head (males only)
distinctions: Venomous fangs, which are extremely poisonous

sub_species.name: Boa constrictor
sub_species.skin: Tanned colors with darker brown markings

sub_species.name: Boomslang
distinctions: Skin is used to make Polyjuice potion

sub_species.name: Selkie
distinctions: One of the species included in the Black Lake merpeople colony

sub_species.name: Merrow
distinctions: Less beautiful than other forms of merpeople

name: Puffskein
distinctions: Scavenger with a diet of leftovers, spiders, moths and bogeys
Emits low humming sound when happy

sub_species.name: Appaloosa Puffskein
distinctions: Used to be illegally bred in New York

sub_species.name: Newt
distinctions: Parts of it is commonly used in potions making

sub_species.name: Fire Dwelling Salamander
distinctions: Their blood has powerful regenerative and curative properties
Is a rare possible corporeal form of the Patronus Charm

name: Giant Squid
distinctions: Eight arms and two long tentacles
One of the largest living organisms on earth

name: Ghost
distinctions: Souls of deceased wizards and witches
